mods.abstract: Female adult, China shoulder head on cloth body, China forearms and lower limbs with boots, molded and painted features and hair, jointed at shoulders and hips, silk underwear and under-skirt with lace trimming, beige tiered lace dress has the same color under-fabric, bateau neckline, flower decoration for forehead and waist, yellow velvet ribbon on waist, doll body, hand-made, dress, hand and machine-made. Accompanying information describes that the China heads were made in the 1850s and 1860s. The dolls were popular during the war between the States especially in the South. The dolls were often hung on the wall near the child's bed. Deterioration of the silk underwear.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
